abstract: A forum in Washington on Tuesday echoed the division that are likely to animate, and perhaps stall efforts next month to hammer out a new climate treaty.
snippet: A forum in Washington on Tuesday echoed the division that are likely to animate, and perhaps stall efforts next month to hammer out a new climate treaty.
lead_paragraph: Speaking at a symposium organized by the Council on Foreign Relations in Washington on Tuesday, Atul Arya, the chief adviser for energy and climate policy for BP, the British oil company, said the odds of achieving a broad, global agreement at climate talks in Copenhagen next month were “very, very low.”
